New Records: Netherlands’ Donyell Malen’s own goal after five minutes 48 seconds was the earliest in UEFA European Championship history.
Marcel Sabitzer became the first Austrian to play 10 matches at the UEFA European Championship, scoring his first goal in the competition from his 22nd shot.
Austria scored their sixth goal at Euro 2024, their most in any edition of the UEFA European Championship and their most in a major tournament (World Cup/Euros) since the 1978 World Cup (7).
Key Match Events: Donyell Malen turned Alexander Prass’ low cross into his own goal in the sixth minute.
Lutsharel Geertruida won possession back in his own half to spring a rapid breakaway, leading to Cody Gakpo's equalizing goal just after the break.
Schmid's header went in off the foot of Stefan de Vrij to restore Austria's lead.
Memphis Depay capped a fine individual performance with a smart volleyed finish to make it 2-2 15 minutes from time.
Marcel Sabitzer’s emphatic strike from a tight angle proved decisive, confirming Austria's victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Few gave Austria much hope before the match, but they remarkably progressed to the knockout stages as Group D winners.
Austria held key midfielders Christoph Baumgartner and Konrad Laimer back for fear of suspension.
Post-Match Reflections: Ralf Rangnick’s men finish top of Group D at Euro 2024 after a fine win on Matchday 3.
Ronald Koeman's Netherlands team looked like lots of spare parts haphazardly thrown together rather than a cohesive team.
Austria's high-octane, eye-catching football caught the imagination of neutrals and has yielded results.
Austria look capable of troubling anyone in the knockout stages.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Austria have reached the knockout stages in their last two appearances at the UEFA European Championships.
Austria have won consecutive UEFA European Championship games for the first time.
Netherlands lost their first group stage game at the UEFA European Championships since 2012.
Austria ended a run of seven consecutive defeats to the Netherlands in all competitions.
